meanings.definition: A group of words that do not form a complete sentence.
meanings.sent1: In the book, there were many nonsentences that confused the readers.
meanings.sent2: The teacher asked the students to identify the nonsentences in the paragraph.
meanings.sent3: The nonsentences in the speech made everyone giggle.
meanings.sent4: Her essay was filled with nonsentences, like scattered puzzle pieces.
meanings.sent5: The nonsentences in the email were like jumbled letters in a word search.

meanings.definition: Lacking the structure or coherence of a typical sentence.
meanings.sent1: The nonsentences writing style of the author was hard to follow.
meanings.sent2: She received a low grade on her essay due to its nonsentences structure.
meanings.sent3: His nonsentences explanation left everyone scratching their heads.
meanings.sent4: The nonsentences plot of the movie was like a maze with no exit.
meanings.sent5: The nonsentences artwork seemed like a chaotic mess of colors and shapes.
